lib.jog

Class graphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.jog.graphics

  • public abstract class graphics
extends java.lang.Object

    jog.graphics

    Provides a layer upon OpenGL methods. jog.graphics allows drawing basic shapes to the screen, as well as images and limited font capabilities. jog.graphics (unlike OpenGL) has the graphical origin to be the window's upper-left corner.

    Author:
    IMP1

             double g,
             double b,
             double a)
        Sets the colour of all things drawn until either the colour is changed again or the end of the draw phase is reached.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component of the colour to draw things.
        g - the green component of the colour to draw things.
        b - the blue component of the colour to draw things.
        a - the alpha component of the colour to draw things.

      • setViewport

        public static void setViewport(int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Sets a new viewport for graphics to be drawn to. Anything graphical that would affect pixels outside the new viewport will not do affect those pixels. All graphical operations are also transformed by the x and y coordinates, essentially setting a new window.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the new viewport, relative to the window.
        y - the y coordinate of the new viewport, relative to the window.
        width - the width of the new viewport, in pixels.
        height - the height of the new viewport, in pixels.

      • setViewport

        public static void setViewport()
        Sets the current viewport back to the default, that is, the window.

                    double y,
                    double quadWidth,
                    double quadHeight,
                    double imageWidth,
                    double imageHeight)
        Creates and returns a new Quad.
        Parameters:
        x - the beginning horizontal coordinate of the quad in pixels.
        y - the beginning vertical coordinate of the quad in pixels.
        quadWidth - the width in pixels of the quad.
        quadHeight - the height in pixels of the quad.
        imageWidth - the width of the image the quad will be a part of.
        imageHeight - the height of the image the quad will be a part of.
        Returns:
        the created quad.

      • draw

        public static void draw(graphics.Image drawable,
        double x,
        double y,
        double r,
        double ox,
        double oy)
        Draws the texture image at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the image to be drawn.
        x - the horizontal pixel to draw at.
        y - the vertical pixel to draw at.
        r - the angle in radians to draw the image at.
        ox - the x coordinate of the origin of the image around which it is rotated.
        oy - the y coordinate of the origin of the image around which it is rotated.

        public static void drawScaled(graphics.Image drawable,
              double x,
              double y,
              double scale)
        Draws a scaled texture image at the specified coordinates The coordinates are also scaled as to ensure the image is drawn in the same position on smaller windows
        Parameters:
        drawable - - the image to be drawn
        x - - the horizontal pixel to draw at.
        y - - the vertical pixel to draw at.
        scale - - The scale to apply to the image

            double x3,
            double y3)
        Draws a triangle.
        Parameters:
        fill - whether to fill with colour (false just draws the lines).
        x1 - the x coordinate of the first point of the triangle.
        y1 - the y coordinate of the first point of the triangle.
        x2 - the x coordinate of the second point of the triangle.
        y2 - the y coordinate of the second point of the triangle.
        x3 - the x coordinate of the third point of the triangle.
        y3 - the y coordinate of the third point of the triangle.

      • arc

        public static void arc(boolean fill,
       double x,
       double y,
       double r,
       double startAngle,
       double angle,
       double segments)
        Draws an arc. That is, a portion of a circle. A curve.
        Parameters:
        fill - whether to fill with colour (false just draws a curved line).
        x - the x coordinate of where the centre of circle would be if an arc of 2pi radians were drawn.
        y - the y coordinate of where the centre of circle would be if an arc of 2pi radians were drawn.
        r - the radius of the circle.
        startAngle - the angle the arc begins at.
        angle - the angle of the arc.
        segments - how many lines segments to draw to approximate the curve.

      • arc

        public static void arc(boolean fill,
       double x,
       double y,
       double r,
       double startAngle,
       double angle)

      • circle

        public static void circle(boolean fill,
          double x,
          double y,
          double r,
          double segments)
        Draws a circle.
        Parameters:
        fill - whether to fill with colour.
        x - the x coordinate of the centre of the circle.
        y - the y coordinate of the centre of the circle.
        r - the radius of the circle.
        segments - how many lines segments to draw to approximate the curve.

        public static void print(java.lang.String text,
         double x,
         double y,
         double size)
        Draws text to the screen using the current font. If no font has yet been made, it creates a default.
        Parameters:
        text - the characters to be drawn.
        x - the x coordinate to draw the text at.
        y - the y coordinate to draw the text at.
        size - the size to draw the text at.

        Parameters:
        text - the characters to be drawn.
        x - - the x coordinate to draw the text at.
        y - - the y coordinate to draw the text at.
        size - - the size to draw the text at.
        scale - - The scale to be applied to the text

        Parameters:

        x - the x coordinate to draw the text at.
        y - the y coordinate to draw the text at.
        size - the size to draw the text at.
        width - the width the text is centred around.
